before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ibk2","text":"Install the needed software (Chimera, COOT) and Phenix or Rosetta.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5jkau","text":"Protocol to model and refine a PDB against a cryo-EM map.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d9404","text":"Split into domains protein models using Chimera that will be used as a starting point (PDBs 6VP7 and 7LHW for RCKW and FL LRRK2, respectively). Save each domain in a PDB file separately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am9bi","text":"Open maps with the best resolution in Chimera and fit every domain PDB into the map. Save the new position for each PDB domain file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75gge","text":"Open PDB files in COOT and merge all files. Save a new PDB file with all domains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7nq0","text":"Check all amino acids manually and refine/regularize them against the cryo-EM map. You can find a basic COOT tutorial for cryo-EM here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pgm5","text":"https://www2.mrc-lmb.cam.ac.uk/personal/pemsley/coot/web/tutorial/Coot-Cryo-EM-basics.html","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":90}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EAEECB7F776211EE87870A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www2.mrc-lmb.cam.ac.uk/personal/pemsley/coot/web/tutorial/Coot-Cryo-EM-basics.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1g9l8","text":"You might want to model amino acids not present in your starting point PDBs if you have empty density. To do that:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adger","text":"1. Add residue (Right side, eighth icon from the bottom)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84qb5","text":"2. Click on the alpha carbon of the last amino acid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q9dd","text":"3. Mutate residue (right side, tenth icon from the bottom). It pops up a list with all amino acids. Click on the amino acid you want to add).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9b9l","text":"Once you manually checked your model, save it. Then, add your ligand. To do that:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uja8","text":"Open the ligand PDB_Ligand.pdb in Chimera, fit it into the map, and save a new file. Open it in COOT together with your model protein and merge them. Save a new PDB with ligan plus protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6osdd","text":"Save your ligand in a PDB file. Open Phenix and use elBOW application to generate restrains for your ligand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uhrd","text":"1. On the right side, click Ligands \u003e elBOW","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd5r0","text":"2. On elBOW setup, click PDB file with hydrogens and/or CONECT records \u003e OK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvedb","text":"3. Click Use simple optimization \u003eOK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhg99","text":"4. In geometry file, browse your PDB_ligand.pdb","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec4vm","text":"5. Browse your output directory","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j9av","text":"6. Type Output file prefix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"362cr","text":"7. Run the job.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ajub","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d3p39","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6bnjf","text":"If you don't have a PDB and you have instead a SMILES notation for your ligand, you can generate a PDB and restrains for it by clicking on the step 2 SMILES string option instead ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"13kl2","text":"Refine/Regularize your ligand against the map in COOT. Save your new PDB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62rkv","text":"Refine your model against your map in Phenix or Rosetta:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rt50","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70gmk","text":"In Phenix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98j41","text":"1. Click Cryo-EM \u003e Refinement \u003e Real-Space Refinement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1is5o","text":"2. Input/Output Tab:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"140j9","text":"    2.a: Type your Job Title","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frov3","text":"    2.b: Add file \u003e PDB_protein+ligand.pdb","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nbvs","text":"    2.c: Add file \u003e map.mrc","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uqh4","text":"    2.d: Add file \u003e Ligand_restrains.cif","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l3jr","text":"3. Add map resolution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q0i4","text":"4. In refinement settings Tab: Keep it as default","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gseo","text":"5. Run the job","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"493pa","text":"6. Once the job is done, open your new PDB_protein+ligand_new.pdb in COOT and check amino acids and restrains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19s1e","text":"7. Check Ramachandran plot. Manually correct amino acid outliers and allowed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s9s1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tdo3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rs15","text":"In Rosetta:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9orbb","text":"1. Remove inhibitors and nucleotides from the model.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3j37","text":"2.  Rosseta/1.3 for refinement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0mnp","text":"3. Move map and pdb into your directory","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bit8","text":"4. Load rosetta using module load rosetta/3.13","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h39l","text":"5. Once is finished go to COOT, add your ligand and remove all the hydrogens from your structure","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15onc","text":"    5.a: To remove hydrogens in COOT, go to Calculate \u003e Scripting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gts4","text":"    5.b: Type delete_hydrogens(#) (# is the model)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7krg4","text":"Check validation parameters and fix outliers you may have in your PDB. Run a refinement in Phenix or Rosetta (it is an iterative process, so you might have to correct/refine it several times).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Model building and refinement of RCKW and FL-LRRK2 bound to inhibitors
title_html: Model building and refinement of RCKW and FL-LRRK2 bound to inhibitors

versions.title: Model building and refinement of RCKW and FL-LRRK2 bound to inhibitors
versions.title_html: Model building and refinement of RCKW and FL-LRRK2 bound to inhibitors
